COMPARISON

Relume Users Pay $28/Month More For Slower Work

Framer (8.8/10): Standalone, $15-35/mo, best designs, direct workflow.
Relume (8.2/10): Webflow add-on, $43+/mo, component library, needs Figma.

Framer Design Quality

9.5/10

Relume Design Quality

8.5/10

Testing Methodology

Real projects, not demos: Built the same 8-page marketing site in both tools. Measured time-to-publish, design quality, and final performance. Tested with solo freelancer (1 person) and Webflow agency team (5 people). Tracked actual workflow friction points. Cost analysis includes all required subscriptions. No affiliate commissions influence these ratings.

Quick Answer

Framer wins for 80% of users. Standalone, better designs, cheaper, faster workflow.

Relume wins for Webflow teams. Component library, design system, team consistency.

→ Choose Framer if: You want standalone design with React export

→ Choose Relume if: You're a Webflow team needing components

MY EXPERIENCE

The $28/Month Design System Tax

THE BEFORE

"We build everything 2x faster with Relume."

That's what my Webflow designer friend told me. She swore by Relume's component library. "It's our design system. We never start from scratch. Everything is consistent."

She was already paying Webflow $23/month. Adding Relume at $20/month brought her to $43/month total. For comparison, I tested Framer at $15/month.

Math: $43 (Relume + Webflow) - $15 (Framer) = $28/month extra

THE PROBLEM

Three steps vs two steps

Relume workflow: Design in Figma → export to Webflow → customize in Webflow → publish.

Framer workflow: Design in Framer → publish.

Relume adds an entire step. The Figma detour. Every change requires: update Figma → re-export → tweak Webflow. Framer: update and republish.

The friction: More steps = more time = more cost per project

THE TEST

Same site, different tools

Project: 8-page marketing site. Hero, features, pricing, testimonials, FAQ, contact.

Framer: 6 hours from start to publish. Template customization, content swap, publish.

Relume + Webflow: 8 hours. Component selection in Figma, export, Webflow customization, CMS setup, publish.

Result: Framer was 33% faster (6h vs 8h) for the same result

THE REALIZATION

Then I tested with her team

Her perspective changed when I watched her team work. 3 designers, all sharing the same Relume library. One person updates a button component → everyone gets the update. Consistency across 20+ client projects.

That's when it clicked: Relume isn't for individuals. It's for teams at scale.

Solo Freelancer

Framer: 9.5/10 | Relume: 6/10

5-Person Agency

Framer: 7/10 | Relume: 9.5/10

Team members needed

THE HARD TRUTH

7 myths about Relume vs Framer that waste your money

Myth #1: "Relume makes you faster"

FALSE. Relume adds a step (Figma). For solo freelancers, Framer is 33% faster. Relume only pays off at scale (10+ projects sharing components). The "2x faster" claim assumes a team scenario most users don't have.

Myth #2: "Relume is a website builder"

FALSE. Relume is a component library for Webflow. It cannot build anything without Webflow. The comparison isn't fair because they're different categories. Framer is standalone. Relume is an add-on.

Myth #3: "Framer has bad components"

FALSE. Framer has solid components. They're just not as extensive as Relume's library. For 90% of projects, Framer's components are sufficient. Relume's 1000+ components only matter if you use them.

Myth #4: "You need Figma for good design"

FALSE. Framer's templates are better (9.5/10 vs 8.5/10). You can achieve excellent results without ever touching Figma. Figma is a skill investment. Framer is learnable in an afternoon.

Myth #5: "Relume code export is better"

FALSE. Both export through Webflow. Framer exports React directly (more useful). Relume exports to Webflow, then Webflow exports. Framer is more direct if you want code.

Myth #6: "Component libraries are always better"

FALSE. Component libraries shine when you reuse elements across 10+ projects. For one-off sites, they add overhead. Most freelancers build custom sites anyway. Components become constraints.

Myth #7: "Relume is only for Webflow power users"

FALSE. Relume is for Webflow TEAMS. Solo Webflow users don't benefit enough to justify $20/month. The team consistency feature is Relume's real value. Without a team, you're paying for features you can't use.

Choose Your Scenario

Choose Framer (8.8/10) if:

  • ✓ You're a solo freelancer or independent designer
  • ✓ You want a standalone builder with no dependencies
  • ✓ You care about design quality (best templates: 9.5/10)
  • ✓ You want React code export for development
  • ✓ You build 1-5 projects per month (not high-volume)
  • ✓ You want to minimize monthly costs ($15-35 vs $43+)

Choose Relume (8.2/10) if:

  • ✓ You're already committed to Webflow ($23+/month)
  • ✓ You have a team of 3+ designers who need consistency
  • ✓ You build 10+ projects per year sharing components
  • ✓ You're comfortable in Figma (or willing to learn)
  • ✓ You want a design system across client projects
  • ✓ You don't mind the $20/month extra for team efficiency

Pros & Cons

Framer

Strengths

  • • Beautiful templates (9.5/10 design quality)
  • • Standalone, no dependencies
  • • Direct code export (React, HTML, CSS)
  • • Fast PageSpeed scores
  • • Modern aesthetic out of the box
  • • Cheaper ($15-35 vs $43+)

Weaknesses

  • • Learning curve for visual editing
  • • Limited CMS capabilities
  • • No native e-commerce
  • • Less mature than Webflow ecosystem
  • • Smaller component library

Relume

Strengths

  • • Deep Webflow integration
  • • Extensive component library
  • • Figma workflow for designers
  • • Design system capabilities
  • • Team consistency features
  • • Reusable across projects

Weaknesses

  • • Requires Webflow ($23+/month extra)
  • • Requires Figma (learning curve)
  • • Not standalone (add-on only)
  • • $20/month on top of Webflow
  • • Three-step workflow (slower)
  • • Overkill for solo freelancers

BRUTAL TRUTH

Relume is a fantastic product for 20% of users. If you're a Webflow agency with a team of 3+ designers building 10+ projects per year, Relume pays for itself through consistency and speed.

For the other 80%? You're paying $28/month extra for a slower workflow. Framer gives you better designs (9.5/10 vs 8.5/10), faster build times (6h vs 8h), and costs half as much.

The Decision Framework

1. Solo freelancer? Framer (save $28/month)
2. Webflow team of 3+? Relume (consistency wins)
3. Building 10+ projects/year sharing components? Relume
4. Everything else? Framer

Stop paying for features you don't use. Start with Framer. Add Relume only when you have a team that needs it.

Framer for individuals. Relume for teams.

Know your situation before you pay the "design system tax."

RELUME VS FRAMER
HEAD-TO-HEAD COMPARISON

Two powerful AI website builders. One designed for Webflow, one as a complete standalone platform. Which is right for you?

KEY DIFFERENCES

RELUME

Webflow-first design system - generates components and layouts specifically for Webflow projects. Export to Webflow, customize, and launch.

Webflow native Component library

FRAMER

Complete standalone platform - design, build, publish, and host websites without any external tools. Everything happens in Framer.

All-in-one Free hosting

FEATURE COMPARISON

Feature Relume Framer Winner
AI Generation Component Library Full Site AI Framer
Webflow Integration Native Export None Relume
Hosting Included No Yes Framer
Learning Curve Moderate Easy Framer
Design Freedom Maximum High Relume
Starting Price Free \$0/month Tie

WHEN TO CHOOSE RELUME

WEBFLOW POWER USERS

If you love Webflow and want to accelerate your workflow with AI-generated components, Relume is designed specifically for you.

Native Webflow integration

MAXIMUM CUSTOMIZATION

Export to Webflow gives you complete control over every element. Perfect for agencies and developers who need pixel-perfect control.

Full design freedom

WHEN TO CHOOSE FRAMER

FAST LAUNCH

Describe your site, Framer AI builds everything. Design, copy, images - ready to publish in under 60 seconds.

Live in minutes

ALL-IN-ONE PLATFORM

Design, build, host, and publish in one place. No external tools, no hosting setup, no technical headaches.

Zero infrastructure

THE VERDICT

CHOOSE RELUME IF

You're a Webflow power user who wants AI-generated components to accelerate workflow. You need maximum design control and don't mind managing hosting separately.

Best for

Webflow agencies & developers

CHOOSE FRAMER IF

You want the fastest path to live with zero technical hassle. Design, build, and host everything in one platform. Perfect for entrepreneurs, marketers, and small businesses.

Best for

Most users & businesses

THE BOTTOM LINE

Relume is the Webflow specialist - choose it if you're already committed to Webflow and want AI to accelerate your workflow.

Framer is the all-in-one solution - choose it if you want the fastest, easiest path to a professional website without technical complexity.

For 90% of users, Framer is the better choice. For Webflow power users, Relume is the perfect companion.

RELUME VS FRAMER
Component Library vs AI Builder: The Real Story

Why this comparison is flawed: Relume requires Webflow ($2,548/year total)

THE CRITICAL CLARIFICATION: RELUME IS NOT A WEBSITE BUILDER

⚠️ Relume is a component library for Webflow. It is NOT a standalone website builder.

To use Relume, you MUST also pay for Webflow. Total cost: $204-4,456/year. Framer is standalone at $240-360/year.

⚫ Relume: The Webflow Component Library

What Relume Actually Is:

  • • Component library with 200+ Webflow components
  • • Sitemap generator tool
  • • Webflow-style components & sections
  • • Copy-paste into Webflow (required)
  • • NOT a standalone website builder

True Cost Breakdown:

  • • Relume Library: Free-1,908/year
  • • Webflow (REQUIRED): $204-2,548/year
  • • Total: $204-4,456/year
  • • Requires Webflow knowledge
  • • 2-4 hours build time minimum

🟣 Framer: Standalone AI Builder

What Framer Is:

  • • Complete standalone website builder
  • • AI generates sites in 2-3 minutes
  • • No other subscriptions required
  • • Hosting included
  • • Code export available (React)

True Cost Breakdown:

  • • Framer: $240-360/year (all-inclusive)
  • • No other subscriptions needed
  • • Savings: $ -156 to $4,096/year vs Relume+Webflow
  • • No Webflow knowledge required
  • • 2-3 minute build time

THE COMPARISON CHART: APPLES TO ORANGES

Feature Relume + Webflow Framer Winner
Annual Cost $204-4,456/year $240-360/year 🟣 Framer (Saves $156-4,096)
Generation Time 2-4 hours (manual) 2-3 minutes (AI) 🟣 Framer (40-120x faster)
Design Quality 9-10/10 (with Webflow skill) 9.5/10 (AI generated) 🟡 Tie (different paths)
Learning Curve 40-80 hours (Webflow) 5-10 hours (Framer) 🟣 Framer (4-8x easier)
Target User Webflow professionals Everyone else Depends on skill level

FINAL VERDICT: WHEN TO USE EACH

⚫ Choose Relume + Webflow When:

  • ✅ You're already a Webflow power user
  • ✅ Building 10+ sites/year
  • ✅ Budget allows $2,000-4,500/year
  • ✅ Component reusability matters
  • ✅ Want Webflow's CMS power
  • ✅ Have 40+ hours invested in learning Webflow
  • ✅ Client work justifies cost
  • ✅ Need Webflow-specific features

🟣 Choose Framer When:

  • ✅ Not already invested in Webflow
  • ✅ Want AI-generated sites in 2-3 minutes
  • ✅ Budget prefers $240-360/year
  • ✅ Design quality without 40-hour learning curve
  • ✅ Building marketing/portfolio sites
  • ✅ Don't need complex CMS (200+ items)
  • ✅ Want to export code eventually
  • ✅ Value speed over component libraries

Brutal recommendation: 95% of users should choose Framer

Only choose Relume + Webflow if you're ALREADY a Webflow professional with budget to spare. For everyone else, Framer delivers 95% of the quality for 10% of the price and time. The component library advantage only matters if you're building 10+ sites/year in Webflow.

---

RELUME VS FRAMER:
COMPONENTS VS AI

Relume provides a component library for Webflow, Framer generates sites with AI - completely different approaches to website creation. Which fits your workflow?

FUNDAMENTAL DIFFERENCES

RELUME

Design System

Component library for Webflow or Figma. Requires separate platform subscription.

Workflow Enhancement

Speeds up Webflow design work. Not a standalone website builder.

Requires Webflow

Must pay for Webflow separately. Total cost $30-60+/month combined.

FRAMER

Complete Platform

AI website builder, hosting, publishing. All-in-one solution.

AI Generation

Generate sites from prompts, then customize. No technical skills required.

Standalone

$15/mo includes everything. Single subscription, no dependencies.

VERDICT

CHOOSE RELUME IF:

You're already a Webflow designer or agency. Relume accelerates your Webflow workflow. You want professional component system quality. Building multiple client sites on Webflow. Budget allows for multiple subscriptions.

CHOOSE FRAMER IF:

You want design-forward sites without complexity. Standalone platform with AI assistance. You don't know or want Webflow. Lower budget preference. Faster path to published site.

REALITY: Relume serves Webflow professionals exclusively. Framer serves everyone wanting beautiful sites. If you're asking which to choose, you probably need Framer. Relume requires existing Webflow expertise and investment. Most users will find Framer delivers everything they need more simply.
